intro: Hirtella maguirei, commonly known as the Guianan hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest regions of Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Hirtella maguirei plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
